_header: Whereas that this land want was for to be
Subjects: Richard II, burial of; historical poems; commemorative verse
_description: Thomas Hoccleve, On Richard II’s burial at Westminster (1399) — six 8-line stanzas (with same three rhymes throughout)

HunHM111.First Lines:
Wher as þat this land wont was for to beOf sad byleeue &
                    constant vnion…
HunHM111.Last Lines:
…Enspire hem þat no longer they foleieTo fathes path hem
                    lede thy pitee Amen
